Articles.Content: I just got this amazing game and got my first rocket into orbit. I didn't have enough fuel to bring it ouf of the orbit back down to Kerbin, but I was able to get the periapsis to be inside Kerbin's atmosphere (around 48,000m right now). My question is will the atmosphere take energy out of the orbit and eventually bring the rocket back down to the planet, Or is my tiny rocket doomed?

Welcome to the forums!

Yes, atmospheric drag will indeed bleed off velocity (and thus, energy) from your orbiting craft as it passes through the atmosphere. At 48 km it might take a few passes for it to be effective, depending on the general size of the orbit, but it'll eventually come back down.

Yes it will. Depending on appoapsis height it might be even in one turn.

You can safely switch to timewarp as game returns to x1 automatically when entering atmosphere.
Whoops, didn't notice you had already asked this elsewhere. Guess I'll have to close this one for housekeeping.
